AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: ATLAS told the customer the blank/“Data not available” reports were normal behavior due to no traffic and said there was no evidence of a malfunction. Later, support analyzed diagnostics and identified an actual monitoring/collector failure causing aggregation/reporting problems, which contradicts ATLAS’s earlier conclusion.
evidence: ATLAS (public, 2025-11-04): "The “Data not available for selected period” message occurs when no traffic has been recorded for the selected subnet or network object during the specified time range. This is a normal behavior in Exinda reporting. It does not indicate a malfunction of the firmware, the reporting mechanism, or a global issue with application recognition."
ATLAS (public, 2025-11-09): "This behavior is in line with normal Exinda operation; there is no evidence of a firmware or reporting engine malfunction."

Syed Haider (public, 2025-11-27): "The logs indicate that the `collectord` process is failing to process network traffic due to a buffer overflow error (`No buffer space available`)... This prevents data from being aggregated for the "Last 24 Hours" reports."

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: Although the customer requested a call, subsequent customer-facing replies were from named human agents (e.g., Rishi Singh, Randall Shawver, Syed Haider), not repeated AI-only interactions after the request.
evidence: Sajeedali Kazi (private, 2025-11-14): "can you schedule a call"
Rishi Singh (public, 2025-11-14): "we need a closer look at the appliance’s internal logs."

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: The customer indicated they had already been providing the requested data repeatedly, and support again requested the same diagnostics/PDF, showing the customer was forced to repeat or re-provide information.
evidence: Sajeedali Kazi (private, 2025-11-19): "can you tell us that how many times you need same data. Have you checked previous update on this ticket provides by us?"

Randall Shawver (public, 2025-11-20): "To do so, we must have the diagnostics file and pdf report. Did you previously upload these, as I do not see them attached to this ticket? If not, please provide these so we can continue the investigation."
Rishi Singh (public, 2025-11-14): "Generate a diagnostics file (sysdump) and PDF report... Attach both files to this ticket."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: The customer repeatedly stated they had been waiting days to weeks with no updates, and the timeline shows long gaps before a meaningful public response (first public reply appears over a month after ticket creation).
evidence: Sajeedali Kazi (private, 2025-10-06): "As we are waiting from last 6 days still, we have not received any updates regarding the same."
Sajeedali Kazi (private, 2025-11-04): "It has been now a month ago but still we haven't received any solution regarding the issue."
Ticket timeline: initial ticket 2025-09-29; first staff public response 2025-11-04 ("We have received your escalation and we are currently working on it.")

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: While support included a standard warning about the ticket staying open for one week unless the customer replies, there is no explicit closure/auto-closure notice shown in the provided text.
evidence: Rishi Singh (public, 2025-11-14): "This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with \"This ticket can be closed\" or update the status to Completed in the portal."

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The customer described missing reports and asked for priority updates, but there is no explicit customer-facing P1/SEV1/critical outage language in public messages. Support ultimately requested diagnostics and provided remediation steps; the internal '[customer_escalation]' severity tag alone is not sufficient per the criteria.
evidence: Customer issue description (private, 2025-09-29): "we are not able to get subnet reports after firmware upgradation"
Priyanka Bhotika (public, 2025-11-04): "We have received your escalation and we are currently working on it."
